original: Exhibit 10.22 STRATEGIC ALLIANCE AGREEMENT (Hyatt Ziva Cancun) THIS STRATEGIC ALLIANCE AGREEMENT  (the “Agreement ”) is made and entered into as of December 14, 2016 (the  “Effective Date ”), by and between  Hyatt Franchising Latin America, L.L.C. , a limited liability company organized and existing under the laws of the State of Delaware (U.S.A.) with its principal place of business located at 71 South Wacker Drive, Chicago, Illinois 60606, U.S.A.  (“Hyatt”), and Playa Hotels  & Resorts, B.V. , a private limited liability company organized and existing under the laws of the Netherlands with its registered address at Prins Bernhardplein 200, 1097 JB Amsterdam, the Netherlands  (“Playa”). Hyatt and Playa are each referred to as a  “Party” and collectively as the “Parties.” R E C I T A L S:
ollama_generated:
In consideration of the mutual covenants contained herein and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, Hyatt and Playa agree as follows:

Original clause (conditional):
If either Party breaches any of its material obligations under this Agreement, the non-breaching Party may terminate this Agreement upon giving written notice to the breaching Party.

Rewritten clause (causing weakening of obligation):
Either Party's failure to perform any material obligation under this Agreement shall not automatically result in termination of this Agreement. Instead, the non-defaulting Party may elect to provide written notice to the defaulting Party, allowing the latter a reasonable opportunity to cure the breach before termination is considered.

original: WHEREAS , Hyatt and Playa are parties to that certain Master Development Agreement dated as of August 9, 2013 (as amended, the  “Master Development Agreement ”) under which Hyatt granted Playa the exclusive (to the extent set forth therein) right, provided that Playa met certain conditions, to develop  all-inclusive  resorts under either or both of the Hyatt Ziva ® or Hyatt Zilara ® brands and other aspects of the proprietary system owned by Hyatt or its affiliates (“ Hyatt All-Inclusive  Resorts”) in the countries of Mexico, Costa Rica, the Dominican Republic, Jamaica and Panama, as their boundaries exist as of the Effective Date (the  “Market Area ”); and WHEREAS , simultaneously with signing this Agreement, Hyatt and Playa or its affiliates are terminating the Master Development Agreement and signing amendments to the following franchise agreements (collectively, the  “Existing Franchise Agreements ”) covering the following Hyatt All-Inclusive  Resorts:
ollama_generated:
WHEREAS, Hyatt and Playa have previously entered into a Master Development Agreement dated August 9, 2013 (as amended, the "Master Development Agreement"), pursuant to which Hyatt granted exclusive rights (subject to the conditions stated therein) to Playa for developing all-inclusive resorts under either or both of the Hyatt Ziva® or Hyatt Zilara® brands and other aspects of the proprietary system owned by Hyatt or its affiliates ("Hyatt All-Inclusive Resorts") within the countries of Mexico, Costa Rica, the Dominican Republic, Jamaica, and Panama, as they were defined on the Effective Date (the "Market Area"). Further, simultaneous with the execution of this Agreement, Hyatt and Playa or its affiliates are terminating the Master Development Agreement and executing amendments to certain existing franchise agreements (collectively, the "Terminated Franchise Agreements") for the following Hyatt All-Inclusive Resorts:

This rewritten clause weakens the obligation by indicating that Hyatt is only granting exclusive rights subject to conditions, and it also inverts the condition by stating that Playa must meet certain conditions in order to exercise the granted rights. Additionally, it shifts the responsibility of terminating the Master Development Agreement to both parties simultaneously with the execution of this new agreement. Lastly, it clarifies that the Terminated Franchise Agreements are being amended, not entirely replaced, which may imply a different level of change or impact compared to signing new agreements.

original: 1. First Offer for Development Opportunities . During the period beginning on the Effective Date and ending on December 31, 2018 (the “Development Term ”), each Party (the “ Offering Party ”) agrees to provide to the other Party (the “ Receiving Party ”) a right of first offer with respect to any proposed offer or arrangement, which the Offering Party (or its affiliate) desires to accept, under which the Offering Party or one of its affiliates would acquire the ownership of real property in the Market Area (the “ Development Property ”) on which a Hyatt All-Inclusive Resort would operate (a “ Development Opportunity ”).
modified: 1. Right of First Refusal for Development Opportunities . During the period commencing on the Effective Date and terminating on December 31, 2018 (the “Development Period”), each Party (hereafter referred to as the "Potential Seller") grants to the other Party (hereafter referred to as the "Interested Party") a right of first refusal with respect to any proposed offer or arrangement, which the Potential Seller (or its affiliate) contemplates accepting, under which the Potential Seller or one of its affiliates would dispose of the ownership of real property in the Market Area (the “Development Property”) on which a Hyatt All-Inclusive Resort would operate (a "Development Opportunity"). However, this right of first refusal is non-binding and shall not obligate the Interested Party to exercise it unless it chooses to do so within the specified timeframe. In the event that the Interested Party exercises its right of first refusal, the Potential Seller shall offer the Development Opportunity to the Interested Party on reasonable terms before pursuing any other offers or arrangements.

original: Attention: Executive Vice President, General Counsel For Playa:
ollama_generated:
Attention: Interim Vice President, Legal Advisor for Sandscape:

Subject to your review and approval:

Playa shall endeavor to exercise due diligence in its activities and decisions that may impact our mutual interests. However, any failure to meet this diligent standard shall not be deemed a breach of contract unless such failure results in material harm or loss to the company, as determined by the Board of Directors in their sole discretion. In such cases, Playa shall indemnify and hold harmless Sandscape for any damages or expenses arising from such breach.

original: Each arbitrator (1) shall have no fewer than ten (10) years’ experience in the international hotel business, (2) shall be licensed to practice law in the United States, and (3) shall not be a person, or an affiliate of a person, who has any past, present or currently contemplated future business or personal relationship with either Playa, Hyatt or any of their respective affiliates.
modified: Each arbitrator (1) need only possess a minimum of five (5) years' experience in the international hotel business, although preference shall be given to those with more extensive backgrounds, (2) may hold a license to practice law in any jurisdiction within the United States, and (3) is not precluded from having any past, present or potential future business or personal relationship with either Playa, Hyatt, or any of their respective subsidiaries; however, it is understood that no such relationships shall influence the arbitrator's impartiality in the proceedings.

original: (c) The place of arbitration shall be New York, New York (USA).
ollama_generated: (c) In the event of any disputes arising out of this agreement, the parties shall submit to arbitration in New York, New York (USA), with the understanding that the Respondent shall have the right to initiate or respond to such proceedings at their discretion.

original: (f) An arbitral tribunal constituted under this Agreement may, unless consolidation would prejudice the rights of any Party, consolidate an arbitration hereunder with an arbitration under any Franchise Agreement between Hyatt (or its affiliate) and Playa (or its affiliate), if the arbitration proceedings raise common questions of law or fact.  If two or more arbitral tribunals under these agreements issue consolidation orders, the order issued first shall prevail.
modified: (f) Each Party reserves the right to unilaterally request consolidation of an arbitration proceeding initiated under this Agreement with any arbitration proceeding governed by a Franchise Agreement between Hyatt (or its affiliate) and Playa (or its affiliate), provided that such consolidation would not disadvantage the requesting Party. In case multiple arbitral tribunals issue consolidation orders, the decision of the tribunal issuing the most recent order shall be binding and supersede any conflicting decisions. This right to request consolidation is exercisable regardless of whether the arbitration proceedings involve common questions of law or fact.

original: (j) The prevailing Party in any arbitration arising out of or related to this Agreement shall be entitled to recover from the losing Party all reasonable fees, costs and expenses incurred by the prevailing Party in connection with such arbitration (including any actions to enforce any award(s) or any of the provisions of this Section 5). If a Party prevails on some, but not all, of its claims, such Party shall be entitled to recover an equitable amount of such fees, costs and expenses as determined by the arbitrator(s). All amounts recovered by the prevailing Party under this Subsection shall be separate from, and in addition to, any other amount included in any award(s) rendered in favor of such Party pursuant to this Section 5.
modified: (j) In any arbitration stemming from or linked to this Agreement, the non-prevailing Party will be obligated to reimburse the successful Party for all reasonable fees, costs, and expenses incurred during such arbitration (including any proceedings to enforce an award(s) or any provisions within this Section 5). If a Party triumphs on some, yet not all, of their claims, they will still be accountable for a fair proportion of the incurred fees, costs, and expenses as decided by the arbitrator(s). All recovered amounts by the successful Party under this Subsection shall be distinct from, and supplementary to, any other amount specified in any award(s) granted in favor of such Party according to this Section 5. This essentially means that the successful Party will recover both the awarded sum and the costs associated with the arbitration.

original: 6. Entire Agreement . This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter of this Agreement and supersedes all prior understandings and writings between the Parties. No Party may rely on any alleged oral or written understandings, agreements, or representations not contained in this Agreement. Any policies that either Party adopts and implements from time to time to guide them in their decision-making are subject to change, are not a part of this Agreement, and are not binding on them.
ollama_generated: 6. Scope of Agreement . This Agreement serves as the comprehensive basis for the Parties' engagement concerning the matters outlined herein, replacing all previous oral or written agreements, understandings, or representations, except as explicitly stated within this document. The Parties acknowledge that no additional agreements, whether oral or written, outside of this Agreement shall be binding unless reduced to writing and signed by both parties. The Parties reserve the right to modify any policies or guidelines they adopt from time to time, which are intended for their internal decision-making processes and do not constitute part of this Agreement nor create any binding obligations.

original: 10. Binding Effect . This Agreement shall inure to the benefit of and bind the permitted assignees, successors and representatives of the Parties, except that no assignment, transfer, pledge, mortgage or lease by or through either Party in violation of the provisions of this Agreement shall vest any rights in the assignee, transferee, mortgagee, pledgee, or lessee, as the case may be.
ollama_generated: 10. Scope of Application . This Agreement will apply to and obligate the authorized assigns, heirs, and delegates of the Parties, on the condition that any assignment, transfer, pledge, mortgage, or lease by or through either Party in contravention of this Agreement's provisions shall not confer any rights upon the assignee, transferee, mortgagee, pledgee, or lessee. Instead, such violations will be deemed null and void, preserving the original rights exclusively for the Parties.

original: 12. Language and Counterparts . This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, all of which, taken together, shall constitute one and the same agreement and a Party may enter into this Agreement by executing a counterpart. This Agreement is executed in the English language, which shall prevail over any translation.
ollama_generated:
12. Multiplicity and Execution of Agreements . This Agreement may be executed in multiple originals, each of which will be considered a single, binding agreement. Any Party shall be deemed to have entered into this Agreement upon executing one such original. This Agreement exists solely in the English language, and in the event of any discrepancy between translations, the English text shall govern.

In this revised clause, I've shifted the responsibility for entering into the agreement onto the Party by specifying that they need to execute only one original copy, while the original clause stated that a Party could enter the agreement by executing a counterpart. Additionally, I've inverted the condition from "this Agreement exists in English" to "the English text shall govern in case of any discrepancy between translations."

original: 15. Corrupt Practices . Neither Party, nor any person acting for or on behalf of such Party, shall make, and each Party acknowledges that the other Party will not make, any expenditure for any unlawful purposes (i.e. unlawful under the laws or regulations of the United States, the European Union or the Market Area) in the performance of its obligations under this Agreement or in connection with its activities in relation thereto. Neither Party, nor any person acting for or on behalf of such Party, shall, and each Party acknowledges that the other Party will not, bribe or offer to bribe any government official, any political party or official thereof, or any candidate for political office, for the purpose of influencing any action or decision of such person in their official capacity or any governmental authority of any jurisdiction.
modified:
15. Permissible Conduct . Each Party is responsible for ensuring that no payments or expenditures made, nor any actions taken, by themselves or on their behalf, violate the laws or regulations of the United States, the European Union, or the Market Area in the fulfillment of their obligations under this Agreement or associated activities. Furthermore, neither Party nor any representative acting on their behalf shall engage in bribery or offer bribes to any government official, political party, or candidate for political office, with the intent of influencing official decisions or actions in a jurisdiction's governing body.

In this revised clause, the responsibility for ensuring compliance has shifted from both parties to each individual party. Additionally, the focus is now on permissible conduct rather than prohibiting corrupt practices.
